title: Belgium
creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
brief_description: A skipper of a barge who travels the canals and rivers of Belgium tells about Belgium, describing its role as a historic invasion route since the days of Caesar. Discusses the country’s bi-lingual system, contrasts the fertile Flanders with the industrial south, and shows the importance of Antwerp as a European harbour.
